trans_title: The Tilted 'X' - Illustrated Lecture on Post-Modernism
The Tilted X - Essay on Postmodernism
introduction: Wearing a professorial suit (without pants), poised at a podium (with large magnifying screen), Professor Al Razutis proceeds to "instruct" with a dildo pointer, reads prepared lecture text using a voice synthesizer (writings based on Frederick Jameson, Arthur Kroker, Gilles Deleuze, Walter Benjamin and others) while a series of slides of "famous modernist paintings" from the US, Canada, and Europe are projected with superimposed projected 16mm film cross-hair - the tilted X.
